answers.answer: Hi tdoggAlcohol contains an extremely large amount of sugar, my friend suffers from diabetes and cannot tolerate any alcohol at all! I am not a medic so cannot give you any further advice, I would however suggest you DEFINATELY do not binge drink!!!Take care :-)
I don't anymore, but any amount of alcohol now affects, or seems to affect, my blood sugar, which b4 it only did after large quantities.
Love your liver, and quit drinking.

question: I am not diabetic, but I have a question about reactive hypoglycemia.  I have had a problem with binge drinking for about 6 years, and my long binges would send me into terrible episodes of hypoglycemia.  But I have since slowed my drinking down substantially, yet any amount of alcohol now seems to give me blood sugar issues, in different extremes.  Could my binge drinking have made my liver more sensitive, to the point where I'll most likely have to abstain completely from alcohol?
title: Alcohol/Hypoglycemia
